channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OK

item.title: Report E-2023110308
item.description:
Report E-2023110308

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-08
  • City: MUSKOGEE
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GREENWOOD MOTOR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A forklift driver accidentally hit a pallet of drums with the freight they had on their forklift, resulting in a release of material on to the dock. The spill was contained and cleaned. All material was placed into an overpack for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110448
item.description:
Report E-2023110448

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: MUSKOGEE
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 10, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2920 was punctured in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted-trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. EWI placed the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 85-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2023110075
item.description:
Report X-2023110075

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-23
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived wet at OKLA731. Package came from LNXA641 trailer 828935. Package was placed in a hazmat tote upon discovery. DescribePack: One metal canister leaked due to a loose cap caused by buildup of pressure from the contents bumping into each other. Contents were not secured in a leak-proof plastic bag. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The package, in a hazmat tote, is then isolated and secured in a hazmat cage.
